body:
Are you using the 3.0.1 release for both the framework and console runner?

The beta bug was a simpler version and was fixed in beta-4. The more complex problem with use of AND is was dealt with and should be corrected in 3.0.1.

I'm using the 3.0.1 NuGet Packages for both framework and console runner.

Console-Runner File Version: 3.0.5813.39037
Framework File-Version:3.0.5813.39031

As I understand, the issue can be reproduced (see details below).
I used the latest versions of NUnit v3.0.1 console and nuget package.

Executed 4 tests:

## id | status | parameters

N1 | **skipped** | NUnit_v3_samples.dll --test=NUnit_v3_samples.NUnitIssue1141
N2 | **skipped** | NUnit_v3_samples.dll --test=NUnit_v3_samples.NUnitIssue1141 --where="cat!=test AND cat!=test2"
N3 | **skipped** | NUnit_v3_samples.dll
N4 | **failed** (expected **skipped**) | NUnit_v3_samples.dll --where="cat!=test AND cat!=test2"

N3:

``` xml
      <test-suite type="TestFixture" id="0-1036" name="NUnitIssue1141" fullname="NUnit_v3_samples.NUnitIssue1141" classname="NUnit_v3_samples.NUnitIssue1141" runstate="Runnable" testcasecount="1" result="Passed" start-time="2015-12-25 08:04:05Z" end-time="2015-12-25 08:04:05Z" duration="0.001399" total="1" passed="0" failed="0" inconclusive="0" skipped="1" asserts="0">
        <test-case id="0-1037" name="ExplicitTestCase" fullname="NUnit_v3_samples.NUnitIssue1141.ExplicitTestCase" methodname="ExplicitTestCase" classname="NUnit_v3_samples.NUnitIssue1141" runstate="Explicit" seed="1002758134" result="Skipped" label="Explicit" start-time="2015-12-25 08:04:05Z" end-time="2015-12-25 08:04:05Z" duration="0.000982" asserts="0">
          <properties>
            <property name="_SKIPREASON" value="" />
          </properties>
          <reason>
            <message><![CDATA[]]></message>
          </reason>
        </test-case>
      </test-suite>
```

N4:

``` xml
      <test-suite type="TestFixture" id="0-1036" name="NUnitIssue1141" fullname="NUnit_v3_samples.NUnitIssue1141" classname="NUnit_v3_samples.NUnitIssue1141" runstate="Runnable" testcasecount="1" result="Failed" site="Child" start-time="2015-12-25 08:05:14Z" end-time="2015-12-25 08:05:14Z" duration="0.003103" total="1" passed="0" failed="1" inconclusive="0" skipped="0" asserts="0">
        <properties />
        <failure>
          <message><![CDATA[One or more child tests had errors]]></message>
        </failure>
        <test-case id="0-1037" name="ExplicitTestCase" fullname="NUnit_v3_samples.NUnitIssue1141.ExplicitTestCase" methodname="ExplicitTestCase" classname="NUnit_v3_samples.NUnitIssue1141" runstate="Explicit" seed="1002758134" result="Failed" start-time="2015-12-25 08:05:14Z" end-time="2015-12-25 08:05:14Z" duration="0.001354" asserts="0">
          <properties>
            <property name="_SKIPREASON" value="" />
          </properties>
          <failure>
            <message><![CDATA[Should never be run, even not if using exclude for categories.]]></message>
            <stack-trace><![CDATA[at NUnit_v3_samples.NUnitIssue1141.ExplicitTestCase() in d:\My\@gh\TechSugar\TestingLab\NUnitSamples\NUnit_v3_samples\NUnitIssue1141.cs:line 12
]]></stack-trace>
          </failure>
        </test-case>
      </test-suite>
```

I thought we had a bug on this problem already, but perhaps it was only discussed in the mail list.

Anyway, it seems to be pretty specific to the use of a top-level AND filter over two NOTs.
Is there a timeframe when a fix could be expected for this one? This bug unfortunately prevents us upgrading to NUnit 3.x

@stffabi unfortunately, we haven't had time to look at this one. If you have time to do some investigation and point out the code that you think is causing the problem, or even submit a PR, then we will get it in much sooner. Beyond that, we are pulling issues in relative priority order, but we are all volunteers, so there is no hard schedule.

issue.title: IsExplicitMatch correctly overriden for CompositeFilters. In a Compos…
issue.body: …iteFilter the IsExplicitMatch function must always be correctly combined by calling the sub-filters IsExplicitMatch function. Fixes #1141

issue.title: Explicit tests are run when excluding more than one category

repository.name: docs
repository.description: Documentation for all active NUnit projects

issue.title: NUnit 3 Console runner executes Explicit tests when filtering by namespace

repository.name: nunit-console
repository.description: NUnit Console runner and test engine

issue.body:
NUnit 3 Console runner executes Explicit tests when filtering by namespace.

We're using NUnit3, the test dll is compiled against NUnit Framwork 3.9.0.0 and using NUnit Console Runner version 3.7.0.0.
We're using Following filter expression:

--where namespace==Some.Namespace.Having.ExplicitTests

but we're finding all the Explicit tests + tests from Explicit Fixture are executed. 

The filter works fine when filter by Class or Category. 

So the Issue is something similar to 
https://github.com/nunit/nunit/issues/1141
https://github.com/nunit/nunit/issues/1039

Any help on this will be highly appreciated!

body:
Hi,

I discovered that this bug persists in NUnit v2.7.0 and v2.7.1, specifically using `NUnit.ConsoleRunner v3.11.1` with `NUnit.Extension.NUnitV2Driver v3.8.0`. I was wondering if not backporting the fix was deliberate or if you didn't know about this until now.

I was not part of the project at that time, but I would say that it was "deliberate", meaning that for a long time it looked like NUnit v 2.6.4 would be the last release of NUnit 2, so changes and bugfixes were for a time only done in NUnit 3. Lately, NUnit 2 has been receiving a few bug-fixes, but mostly driven by individual PRs. Also note that NUnit 2 has a different code structure than NUnit 3, so it is not always easy to backport changes.

Given that you are using the console runner for NUnit 3 with the NUnitV2Driver I'm not sure where one would solve this issue, but I guess in either the NUnitV2Driver or the framework, or a combination. It sounds related to nunit/nunit-v2-framework-driver#21, so a guess would be in this project.
